00040 #ifndef _graphicsmanager_h
00041 #define _graphicsmanager_h
00042 
00043 #include "managerbase.h"
00044 
00045 namespace Ogre
00046 {
00047     class Timer;
00048 }
00049 
00050 namespace phys
00051 {
00052     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00053     /// @class GraphicsManager
00054     /// @headerfile graphicsmanager.h
00055     /// @brief This is intended to store basic graphics setting for the user.
00056     /// @details This stores x/y resolution, fullscreen and in the future other
00057     /// settings. This is intended to make it easy for developers to pass/move around
00058     /// complex graphics settings. We hope to eventually include other items like
00059     /// shader settings, rendering API, and maybe other settings too.
00060     class GraphicsManager: public ManagerBase
00061     {
00062         private:
00063 
00064             /// @internal
00065             /// @brief This is the desired state of whether the window is fullscreen or not.
00066             bool Fullscreen;
00067 
00068             /// @internal
00069             /// @brief This stores the Height of the renderwindow
00070             Whole RenderHeight;
00071 
00072             /// @internal
00073             /// @brief This stores the Width of the renderwindow
00074             Whole RenderWidth;
00075 
00076             /// @brief Adjust all Settings
00077             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World to which this GrapchisManager will be attached
00078             /// @param Width_ The desired width.
00079             /// @param Height_ The desired height.
00080             /// @param FullScreen_ True if fullscreen, false if not.
00081             /// @details This adjusts most data in this Graphics Settings and accepts new resolution and fullscreen settings. Be
00082             /// careful that the settings selected are appropriate. Many mobile devices do not support windows, and many screens
00083             /// do not support arbitrary resolutions in fullscreen mode.
00084             void Construct( World* GameWorld_, const Whole &Width_, const Whole &Height_, const bool &FullScreen_);
00085 
00086             Ogre::Timer *RenderTimer;
00087 
00088             Whole FrameDelay;
00089 
00090         public:
00091             /// @brief Basic constructor
00092             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World to which this GrapchisManager will be attached
00093             /// @details This creates a basic Graphics Settings with resolution 640x480 with fullscreen set to false
00094             GraphicsManager(World* GameWorld_);
00095 
00096             /// @brief Versatile Constructor
00097             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World to which this GrapchisManager will be attached
00098             /// @param Width_ The desired width.
00099             /// @param Height_ The desired height.
00100             /// @param FullScreen_ True if fullscreen, false if not.
00101             /// @details This creates a Graphics Settings with resolution and fullscreen passed into to it. Be careful that the
00102             /// settings selected are appropriate. Many mobile devices do not support windows, and many screens do not support
00103             /// arbitrary resolutions in fullscreen mode.
00104             GraphicsManager( World* GameWorld_, const Whole &Width_, const Whole &Height_, const bool &FullScreen_);
00105 
00106             /// @brief Gets the Fullscreen Setting
00107             /// @details Gets the Fullscreen Setting
00108             /// @return This returns a bool, true if fullscreen is set, false otherwise
00109             bool getFullscreen() const;
00110 
00111             /// @brief Set the Fullscreen Setting
00112             /// @details Set the Fullscreen Setting
00113             /// @param Fullscreen_ This accepts a bool. True for fullscreen, false for windowed
00114             void setFullscreen(const bool &Fullscreen_);
00115 
00116             /// @brief Gets the Height of the Rendering Area
00117             /// @details Gets the Height of the Rendering Area
00118             /// @return This returns the Height of the Rendering Area
00119             Whole getRenderHeight() const;
00120 
00121             /// @brief Sets the Height.
00122             /// @details Set the Render Height inside the window in windowed mode, set the resolution of the screen in fullscreen
00123             /// @param Height_ This accepts a Whole.
00124             void setRenderHeight(const Whole &Height_);
00125 
00126             /// @brief Gets the Width of the Rendering Area
00127             /// @details Gets the Width of the Rendering Area
00128             /// @return This returns the Width of the Rendering Area
00129             Whole getRenderWidth() const;
00130 
00131             /// @brief Sets the Width.
00132             /// @details Set the Render Width inside the window in windowed mode, set the resolution of the screen in fullscreen
00133             /// @param Width_ This accepts a Whole.
00134             void setRenderWidth(const Whole &Width_);
00135 
00136             /// @brief Changes the X and Y Resolution at the same time
00137             /// @details This should be useful in situations where it is not possible to update the width and hright separately.
00138             /// @param Width_ The new desired Width for the rendering area as a whole number
00139             /// @param Height_ The new desired Width for the rendering area as a whole number
00140             void setRenderResolution(const Whole &Width_, const Whole &Height_);
00141 
00142             /// @brief This Shows an Engine Generated Configuration Screen
00143             /// @details This could look like and could offer just about any option to the user. It is loosely expected to show Graphical Configuration
00144             /// options, like Vsync and Resolution, But it might ask some really silly stuff. I think this would be fine for smaller simpler apps
00145             /// Which have no other way to configure such things, but any sizable project should develop their own way to expose and manage
00146             /// user settings.
00147             bool ShowGraphicsSettingDialog();
00148 
00149         //Inherited from ManagerBase
00150             /// @brief Empty Initializor
00151             /// @details This specific initializor is unneeded, but we implement it for compatibility. It also exists
00152             /// in case a derived class wants to override it for some reason
00153             virtual void Initialize();
00154 
00155             /// @brief This is where the rendering takes place.
00156             /// @details This does the rendering for the game using all the actors in the actormanager.
00157             virtual void DoMainLoopItems();
00158 
00159             /// @brief This returns the type of this manager.
00160             /// @return This returns ManagerTypeName::GraphicsManager
00161             virtual ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00162 
00163             /// @brief This is derived from and uses the ManagerBase to perform the the post main loop callbacks
00164             /// @return This returns a true or false depending on what the callback returns
00165             virtual bool PostMainLoopItems();
00166 
00167     };
00168 }
00169 #endif
